intro: Uragoga axillaris, commonly known as the axillary uragoga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Uragoga axillaris is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
